title: Integrated Encoding-Decoding Instructional Design for Children at Risk of Reading Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of foundational reading education theory and understanding of reading disorders
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, with the goal of strengthening practical competencies for designing and implementing educational programs for children with reading disabilities.

learning_goals: Explain core principles of integrated encoding-decoding instructional methods and propose three or more educational strategies for children at risk of reading disabilities.
Design personalized reading education plans utilizing integrated encoding (spelling) and decoding (reading) activities.
Establish measurable indicators of educational effectiveness and derive improvement strategies using research-based data.

resources: Integrated instructional design case study materials
Reading disability assessment checklist for children

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
